Forest Runners
Zoning

Zoning
+1 [ICON_Housing] Housing in all cities with at least 1 specialty districts.
+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity to all cities with at least 1 specialty districts.
+3 Loyalty per turn for cities with a garrisoned unit.
Accumulate 25% less war weariness than usual. Cities with a garrisoned unit get +6 Loyalty per turn.
[ICON_Governor] Governors provide +4 Loyalty per turn to their city.
[ICON_Governor] Governors provide +2 Loyalty per turn to their city, in addition to +1 Loyalty per turn for every level of the [ICON_Governor] Governor.
Rock Bands from other players may not enter your territory. -2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities in all of your cities with 10 or more [ICON_Citizen] Population.
+2 [ICON_Production] Production and +8 [ICON_Gold] Gold from all [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward walls.
+6 City [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength. +6 City [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength.
+1 Movement if starting turn in friendly territory. Newly trained Military Engineers gain 1 extra charge.
+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each Research Lab, Military Academy, Seaport, Coal Power Plant, Oil Power Plant, and Nuclear Power Plant.
Accumulate 25% less war weariness than usual. +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity for cities with a garrisoned unit.
[ICON_GOVERNOR] Governors provide +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity and +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing.
[ICON_Tourism] Tourism from other players is reduced by 30% versus your civilization.
When you reduce a player's Diplomatic Victory points in the World Congress, get 50% of your spent [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor back. +2 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn.
+6 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn.
All units gain +50% combat experience.
+2 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer points per turn. +2 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer points per turn for every Workshop.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Ancient and Classical era naval units.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Industrial era and earlier naval units.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward all naval units, excluding Carriers.
+50% [ICON_Science] Science in cities with a Holy Site.[NEWLINE]BUT: -25% [ICON_Culture] Culture in all cities.
Start Inquisition with 1 Apostle charge. All Religious units +10 [ICON_Religion] Religious Combat Strength in friendly territory.[NEWLINE]BUT: -25% [ICON_Science] Science in all cities.

All Civilizations not currently at war receive +100% of the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from your Concerts.[NEWLINE]BUT: Units other than Rock Bands receive -75% [ICON_Production] Production for producing, and cost +200% [ICON_Gold] Gold for purchasing.
Your cities get +30% [ICON_Production] Production towards city projects.[NEWLINE]BUT: -1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity and -6 Loyalty per turn in your cities.
+2 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn for each Broadcast Center.[NEWLINE]BUT: -25% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture in all cities.
Spies who steal a tech boost without being detected gain an extra boost. +1 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor for every Research Lab.
+100% Theater Square district adjacency bonuses. Stadiums and Aquatics Centers generate +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity.

Your Spy units can choose from any possible promotion. Foreign [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes provide +2 [ICON_Production] Production for their cities, +3 [ICON_Science] Science and +1 [ICON_Production] Production to your cities.

Your Rock Band units can choose from any possible promotion. Foreign [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes provide +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith for their cities, +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to your cities.
All Religious units gain +5 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength in Theological Combat. All Warrior Monks gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to an Ally or Suzerain's city provide +3 [ICON_Food] Food and +3 [ICON_Production] Production for both cities. Alliance Points with all allies increase by an additional .25 per turn.
+0.8 [ICON_Production] Production per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen in cities with [ICON_Governor] Governors.
All units gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking. War Weariness reduced by 25%.
+30% Production toward Units.
+15% [ICON_GOLD] Gold in all cities with an established [ICON_Governor] Governor.
+20% Production toward Districts.

All Religious units gain +5 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength in Theological Combat. All Warrior Monks gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.[NEWLINE]+0.4 [ICON_Faith] Faith per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen in cities with [ICON_Governor] Governors.
+1 [ICON_Housing] Housing per level of Walls.
+30% Influence Points.
Your specialty districts on or next to Coast or Lake tiles provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Your Trader units are immune to being plundered.
Land combat or Support units are 10% cheaper to purchase with [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each Encampment district building in that city.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to any city-state provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every specialty district in the origin city.
Your cities have full [ICON_Housing] Housing from water, as if they were all next to a River. Border expansion rate is 25% faster.
Your cities get +30% [ICON_Production] Production towards city projects.
You receive +2 Loyalty per turn in cities for each Encampment district building. Culture Bomb adjacent tiles when completing an Encampment in any city.
Provides you with 2 of each Strategic resource per turn that you have revealed.
Receive a [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic every time you discover a new natural wonder, and earn +100% [ICON_Faith] Faith from all [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics.
Your specialty districts on or next to Coast or Lake tiles provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Your Trader units are immune to being plundered.
Land combat or Support units are 10% cheaper to purchase with [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each Encampment district building in that city.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to any city-state provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every specialty district in the origin city.
Your cities have full [ICON_Housing] Housing from water, as if they were all next to a River. Border expansion rate is 25% faster.
Your cities get +30% [ICON_Production] Production towards city projects.
You receive +2 Loyalty per turn in cities for each Encampment district building. Culture Bomb adjacent tiles when completing an Encampment in any city.
Provides you with 2 of each Strategic resource per turn that you have revealed.
Receive a [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic every time you discover a new natural wonder, and earn +100% [ICON_Faith] Faith from all [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Classical and Medieval era land units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Medieval and Renaissance era land units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Renaissance and Industrial era land units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Industrial and Modern era land units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Modern and Atomic era land units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Atomic and Information era land units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Information era land units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Classical and Medieval era naval units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Medieval and Renaissance era naval units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Renaissance and Industrial era naval units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Industrial and Modern era naval units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Modern and Atomic era naval units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Atomic and Information era naval units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to Information era naval units within 2 tiles.[NEWLINE]+6 Loyalty per turn to cities within 2 tiles.
Grants +3 Loyalty per turn for this city.
Grants 1 promotion level and +50% combat experience to a military land unit.
+50% Earned experience from combat (Timur)
Grants +6 Loyalty per turn for this city.
Grants 1 promotion level and +100% combat experience to a military land unit.
+100% Earned experience from combat. (John Monash)
Instantly builds a Hangar in this district.
+20% [ICON_Production] Production towards military units.
+3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +50% flanking bonus for all land units.
+3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all land units. (Georgy Zhukov)
+{1_Amount} Combat Strength from Georgy Zhukov
Grants +6 Loyalty per turn for this city.
Grants 1 promotion level and +50% combat experience to a military naval unit.
+50% Earned experience from combat (Himerios)
+1 sight range for all naval units. Allows all units to move over ocean tiles without the normal technology requirement.
Gain 500 [ICON_Gold] Gold (on Standard speed). Military units get +50% rewards for plundering sea [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.
+50% Rewards for plundering trade routes. (Ching Shih)
+50% flanking bonus for all naval units.
Grants 1 promotion level and +100% combat experience to a military naval unit.
+100% Earned experience from combat (Laskarina Bouboulina)
Instantly creates a Battleship unit with 1 promotion level. Grants 2 [ICON_RESOURCE_Coal] Coal per Turn.
+1 Military policy slot in any government.
All current units gain a Promotion level.
Triggers the [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration moment for {Amount} random {Amount : plural 1?civic; other?civics;} from the Renaissance era.
Gain {Amount} [ICON_Faith] Faith.
+25% [ICON_Production] Production toward Districts.
Triggers the [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka moment for {Amount} random {Amount : plural 1?technology; other?technologies;} from the Atomic or Information era.
+30% [ICON_Production] Production towards city projects.
Grants {Amount} [ICON_Production] Production.
+{Amount}% [ICON_Science] Science in all cities.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and exert +100% Religious pressure.
Gain {Amount : number #} [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor.
Gain {Amount : number #} [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Grants {Amount} [ICON_RESOURCE_TOYS] Toys, a uniquely manufactured Luxury resource which provides +6 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities.
Gain {Amount : number #} [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor.

Grants a free Trader unit in this city, and increases [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity by 2. +25% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism rate towards other civilizations you have a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route to.
Campus districts provide +3 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism and +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity.
Industrial Zone districts provide +3 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism and +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity.
Campus districts get +{Amount} [ICON_Science] Science if adjacent to a river.
Chosen Campus gains +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity. Increases non-[ICON_Food]Food yield benefits of Happiness in your empire by 50%.
Gain 300 [ICON_Science] Science (on Standard speed) for each adjacent Mountain tile.
Gain 600 [ICON_Science] Science (on Standard speed) for each natural wonder tile here or adjacent.
[ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas provide an additional 10% of technology costs.
+1 [ICON_Science] Science from Strategic resources that you have revealed.
Each city receives +1 [ICON_Science] Science for each specialty district.
Grants 1500 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture (on Standard speed).
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent Commercial Hub district.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent Suguba district.

A district that provides this city with extra source of fresh water from an adjacent River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain.[NEWLINE]Cities with existing fresh water(including that of dam and canal) get +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and other cities get +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing, in addition to full [ICON_Housing] Housing from fresh water. +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity if adjacent to a Geothermal Fissure. Prevents [ICON_Food] Food loss during Drought.

A district built on a Floodplains tile to improve the comfort of living along this river.[NEWLINE]Cities get full [ICON_Housing] Housing from fresh water if built next to the city center. Prevents damage from flooding of this river (though yields from flooding drop by 50%). Prevents [ICON_Food] Food loss during Drought.
A district built on flat land to connect two bodies of water or a body of water to a City Center.[NEWLINE]Cities get full [ICON_Housing] Housing from fresh water if built next to the city center.
Provides +2 Loyalty per turn in this city. If the city already has maximum Loyalty, also provides an additional +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.

+1 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Food] Food if you own [ICON_RESOURCE_WHEAT] Wheat, [ICON_RESOURCE_RICE] Rice, [ICON_RESOURCE_MAIZE] Maize, [ICON_RESOURCE_BANANAS] Bananas, [ICON_RESOURCE_SHEEP] Sheep, or [ICON_RESOURCE_CATTLE] Cattle.

[ICON_RESOURCE_WHEAT] Wheat, [ICON_RESOURCE_RICE] Rice, [ICON_RESOURCE_MAIZE] Maize, [ICON_RESOURCE_BANANAS] Bananas, [ICON_RESOURCE_SHEEP] Sheep, and [ICON_RESOURCE_CATTLE] Cattle gain +1 [ICON_Food] Food each. City must be adjacent to a River.
+1 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity if the city has Aqueduct, Dam, or Canal built next to the city center.

Protects Coastal Lowland tiles in this city from flooding. If constructed after some of a city's tiles have been flooded, those tiles can be repaired in full, but submerged tiles are never recoverable. Must be built in a city with one or more Coastal Lowland tiles.

Grants +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith to adjacent Charming tiles. Increased to +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith, +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for adjacent Breathtaking tiles without improvements.

Grants +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to adjacent Charming tiles. Increased to +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, +3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for adjacent Breathtaking tiles without improvements.
+1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science from each [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great Work of Writing if the city also has Amphitheater building.

Bonus [ICON_Amenities] Amenities extend to each city center within 6 tiles. This bonus applies once to a city, and multiple copies of this building within 6 tiles of a city center do not provide additional bonuses.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city [ICON_CITIZEN] population is 10 or higher and +4 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city [ICON_CITIZEN] population is 20 or higher. +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from each [ICON_GreatWork_Music] Great Work of Music if the city also has Broadcast Center building.

Bonus [ICON_Amenities] Amenities extend to each city center within 9 tiles. This bonus applies once to a city, and multiple copies of this building within 9 tiles of a city center do not provide additional bonuses.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism for each Wonder built in this city on or adjacent to a Coast tile. +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from each [ICON_GreatWork_Music] Great Work of Music if the city also has Broadcast Center building.

+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food on all Coast tiles for this city. +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing if this city is adjacent to coast. +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, if this city does not yet have a Market building.[NEWLINE]Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased +5, if this city does not yet have a Barracks or Stable building. (on Standard Speed).

+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city. Bonus [ICON_Production] Production equal to the adjacency bonus of the Harbor district. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on all Reef tiles for this city.[NEWLINE]Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased +5, if this city does not yet have a Armory building. (on Standard Speed).

+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city. Allows Fleets and Armadas to be trained directly. Fleet and Armada training costs reduced 25%. +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold on all Coast tiles for this city.[NEWLINE]Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased +5, if this city does not yet have a Military Academy building. (on Standard Speed).

+2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities and +4 [ICON_Housing] Housing in Cities with [ICON_Governor] Governors[NEWLINE]This city can build one more district than the [ICON_Citizen] Population limit allows.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.

50% increased [ICON_Production] Production toward Settlers in this City.[NEWLINE]New cities receive a free Builder and start with three additional tiles.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.

Capturing an enemy City grants 20% bonus [ICON_Production] Production in all Cities for 5 turns.[NEWLINE]This bonus is increased to 50% for this city.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.

+4 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor. Leveraging City States costs half [ICON_Gold] Gold.[NEWLINE]City State units gain +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if you are the City State's Suzerain (including Leveraged Units).[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
+1 Spy and Spy capacity.[NEWLINE]All Spy Operations have a higher chance of success.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
Grants the ability to buy land units with [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
All units heal up to 20 hit points when they eliminate a unit.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
Provides 4 slots for any Great Work.[NEWLINE]Enemies receive 50% more war weariness from fighting against you.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
Builders gain the ability to use all of their charges to provide bonus [ICON_Production] Production to a District Project. Once per city per turn.[NEWLINE]Awards +1 [Icon_Governor] Governor Title.
+3 Influence Points per turn. When this civilization captures or kills an enemy Spy, receive 100 [ICON_Science] Science (on Standard Speed) for every level of the enemy Spy.

Unlocks the Military Engineer ability to construct a Fort.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production. Occupying unit receives +4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength, and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Production] Production if the city has a garrisoned unit.
Unlocks the Military Engineer ability to construct an Airstrip.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Production] Production. Can support 2 air units. Can only be built on flat terrain. -1 Appeal.
Unlocks the Military Engineer ability to construct a Missile Silo.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Production] Production. Acts as a launch site for Nuclear and Thermonuclear Devices.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Ski Resort.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism equal to the number of adjacent facilities. Provides an [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity.[NEWLINE]Can only be built on a Mountain (Except for Desert Mountain). Cannot be built adjacent to another Ski Resort. Cannot be pillaged or removed.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Seaside Resort.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism equal to the tile's Appeal.[NEWLINE]Can only be built on flat Desert, Plains, or Grassland terrain adjacent to Coast. Minimum Appeal of Breathtaking.

Unlocks the Military Engineer ability to construct a Mountain Tunnel.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Acts as a movement portal on a mountain range, allowing units to move into it and exit from another portal at the cost of 2 [ICON_Movement] Movement.[NEWLINE]Can only be built on an adjacent Mountain tile. Cannot be pillaged or removed.
Provides +4 [ICON_Power] Power per turn from renewable water sources.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Extra +2 [ICON_Power] Power per turn when the Computers technology is researched.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Wind Farm.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, and +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science. Provides +1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn from renewable wind sources.[NEWLINE]Extra +1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold if built adjacent to Coast.[NEWLINE]Can only be built on Hills terrain.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct an Offshore Wind Farm.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, and +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science. Provides +2 [ICON_Power] Power per turn from renewable wind sources.[NEWLINE]Extra +1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold if built on Ocean.[NEWLINE]Can only be built on Coast, Lake or Ocean terrain.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Solar Farm.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, and +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science. Provides +1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn from renewable solar sources.[NEWLINE]Extra +1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold if built on Desert.[NEWLINE]Extra +1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn when the Composites technology is reseached.[NEWLINE]Can only be built on flat terrain.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Geothermal Plant.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, and +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science. Provides +2 [ICON_Power] Power per turn from renewable geothermal sources.[NEWLINE]Extra +2 [ICON_Power] Power per turn, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold if built on a Geothermal Fissure.[NEWLINE]Can only be built on Geothermal Fissure or Volcanic Soil.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Seastead.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_FOOD] Food. +1 [ICON_Production] Production for each adjacent Fishing Boats. Fishing Boats receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production for each adjacent Seastead. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each adjacent Offshore Wind Farm. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism for each adjacent Reef. +2 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing.[NEWLINE]Can only be built on Coast, Lake or Ocean terrain. Cannot be built adjacent to another Seastead.

Expected

No overall decline of Marsh, Woods, and Rainforest features on the planet is recorded.
Removal of Marsh, Woods, and Rainforest features from the planet has been minimal to date.
Removal of Marsh, Woods, and Rainforest features from the planet has been light to date.
Removal of Marsh, Woods, and Rainforest features from the planet has proceeded at the expected pace.
Removal of Marsh, Woods, and Rainforest features from the planet has been considerable to date.
Removal of Marsh, Woods, and Rainforest features from the planet has been extensive.
Removal of Marsh, Woods, and Rainforest features from the planet has reached extreme degree.
Almost all of Marsh, Woods, and Rainforest features from the planet has been destroyed.

Three tile natural wonder. It provides +6 [ICON_Science] Science, and +3 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles. Units that enter it are teleported to an ocean far away, but naval units that do so earn the ability 'Mysterious Currents' (+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement).
Four tile natural wonder. It provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Production] Production, and +2 [ICON_Science] Science.

Two tile natural wonder. It appears with Cliffs adjacent to water and provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture. Also provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles. Improvements cannot be placed on it.

One tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +3 [ICON_Science] Science, +5 [ICON_Faith] Faith, and Fresh Water. Also provides +4 appeal, instead of the usual +2 appeal to adjacent tiles.

Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +1 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith. Units heal completely if they heal for one turn in adjacent plots. Does not provide Fresh Water.
One tile impassable natural wonder. It provides +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_Science] Science, and +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles.
One tile impassable natural wonder. It provides +2 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith to adjacent tiles.

Three tile natural wonder. It provides +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith. After the game reaches the Atomic Era it provides an additional +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +4 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science.

Two tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Volcano and provides +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles. On eruption it gives medium yields and is most likely to damage buildings and districts. Infrequently erupts, but is always active.

One tile natural wonder. It provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food and +3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, and Fresh Water. Land combat units that enter the tile receive the ability 'Water of Life' (+10 HP healing in any territory).
Two tile impassable natural wonder. It appears on coastal terrain and provides +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.
Two tile impassable natural wonder. It provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles. Land combat units that enter adjacent plots receive the ability, 'Spear of Fionn' (+5 combat strength).
Three tile natural wonder. It provides +3 [ICON_Production] Production and +4 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.

Two tile natural wonder. It can be found on coastal terrain and provides +3 [ICON_Food] Food, +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold, and +3 [ICON_Science] Science. Also provides major adjacency bonus to Campus district.

Two tile natural wonder. It can be found on coastal terrain and provides +3 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +15 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending in this tile.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to adjacent tiles, and Fresh Water. +50% [ICON_Production] Production when producing wonders and districts in adjacent tiles.

Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +1 [ICON_Production] Production, +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold, and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture. Also provides +4 appeal, instead of the usual +2 appeal to adjacent tiles. Does not provide Fresh Water.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Production] Production to adjacent tiles. Naval combat units that enter adjacent plots for the first time are granted their next promotion.

One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles. Also provides +4 appeal, instead of the usual +2 appeal to adjacent tiles. Land combat units that enter adjacent plots gain +4[ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and ignore Movement penalty in Hill terrain.

Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles. Religious units that enter adjacent plots gain +4[ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and ignore Movement penalty in Hill terrain.

One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Volcano and provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food to adjacent tiles. On eruption it gives low yields and is most likely to damage improvements and buildings. Infrequently erupts, but is always active.
Four tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Science] Science and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles.

One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Volcano and provides +1 [ICON_Production] Production to adjacent tiles. On Eruption it gives high yields to adjacent tiles, but large [ICON_Citizen] Population loss. It is always active.

Three tile impassable natural wonder. It provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles. The city that owns at least one of the tiles receives +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold on its outgoing international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.

Two tile impassable natural wonder. It provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to adjacent tiles, and Fresh Water. The city that owns at least one of the tiles receives +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity, and an additional +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity if adjacent to an Entertainment Complex. Major adjacency bonus to Theater Square, Campus, and Commercial Hub districts, and standard adjacency bonus to the Holy Site district.
Four tile natural wonder. It appears as Marsh and provides +4 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. It provides +1 [ICON_Science] Science and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles.
Four tile natural wonder. It provides +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and +5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Two tile impassable natural wonder. It doubles the terrain yields of all adjacent tiles.
One tile impassable natural wonder. It provides +1 [ICON_Science] Science, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles.
Four tile natural wonder. It appears as Marsh and provides +1 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Production] Production, and +3 [ICON_Faith] Faith.
One tile impassable natural wonder. It provides +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles. Also provides +4 appeal, instead of the usual +2 appeal to adjacent tiles.
Two tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.

Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to adjacent tiles. If you own at least one of the tiles, you receive 2 [ICON_GREATGENERAL] Great General points and 2 [ICON_GREATMERCHANT] Great Merchant points.
Alpine Training: +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in Hills and no Movement penalty in Hill terrain.
+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in Hills
Altitude Training: +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in Hills and no Movement penalty in Hill terrain.
+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in Hills

Launch Military Satellite
Launch Military Satellite
Space project which launches a satellite into orbit to aid military force. All units gain +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. Requires 30 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum to begin construction.
You've successfully launched a military satellite into orbit! Provides support to all your units in battle.
Launch Broadcast Satellite
Launch Broadcast Satellite

Repeatable Space project which launches a satellite into orbit to improve broadcast service. +5% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism across your empire. Requires 15 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum to begin construction.
You've successfully launched a broadcast satellite into orbit! Your cultural programs can be received better around the world.
Launch Communication Satellite
Launch Communication Satellite

Space project which launches a satellite into orbit to establish communication network. +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes and +2 [ICON_Production] Production from domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. Requires 30 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum to begin construction.
You've successfully launched a communication satellite into orbit! Makes trades more profitable with faster flow of information.
Launch Solar Energy Satellite
Launch Solar Energy Satellite

Repeatable Space project which launches a satellite into orbit to gather solar energy. Provides +6 [ICON_Power] Power to the city from renewable solar sources. Requires 15 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum to begin construction.
You've successfully launched a solar energy satellite into orbit! Provides clean solar power to this city via microwave transmissions.
Launch Weather Satellite
Launch Weather Satellite

Space project which launches a satellite into orbit to gather weather data. +1 [ICON_Food] Food for each Farm (including Terrace Farm) and +1 [ICON_Production] Production for each Farm (including Terrace Farm) on a resource in your empire. Requires 30 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum to begin construction.
You've successfully launched a weather satellite into orbit! Allows your farmers to make better decisions regarding agriculture.
Launch Ecology Satellite
Launch Ecology Satellite

Repeatable Space project which launches a satellite into orbit to maintain ecology in the area. Provides +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity to the city. Requires 15 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum to begin construction.
You've successfully launched a ecology satellite into orbit! Allows sustainable growth by restoring local ecosystem.

+20% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and 10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in all cities. If there are 5 Snow or Snow Hills tiles within 3 tiles of a city and owned by this player these yields are doubled. Must be built adjacent to a Campus district on a Snow or Snow Hills tile.

+100% [ICON_POWER] Power for all Offshore Windfarms, Solar Farms, Wind Farms, Geothermal Plants, and Hydroelectric Dams. This building and these improvements provide [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism equal to their [ICON_POWER] Power. +1 Appeal to tiles adjacent to Rainforest and Marsh in your empire. Must be built adjacent to a Neighborhood district.
Grants a free [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician, and awards 2 randomly-chosen free civics when completed. Must be built on flat land adjacent to a Theater Square district.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production on all Rainforest tiles in your empire. Extra +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture on all Rainforest tiles for this city. Must be built on Rainforest.

+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. Cities with both Market and Lighthouse building gain +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. Grants a Trader unit. Must be built on the Coast, adjacent to land and a Harbor district.

+1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on all Marsh tiles in your empire. +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on all Floodplains tiles for this city. Must be built on Floodplains or Marsh.

+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for all naval and embarked units. +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admirals. Must be built on the Coast, and adjacent to land and a Harbor district.
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from each [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Works of Art in your empire. Must be built along a River.

+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity from entertainment for each Lake tile within one tile of Huey Teocalli. +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Production] Production on each Lake tile in your empire. Extra +1 [ICON_Food] Food for each Lake tile on this city. Must be built on a Lake tile adjacent to land.
Awards 6 [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron per turn. Provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science and +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith to all your cities that are within 6 tiles. Must be built on Desert (Hills) terrain.

+20% [ICON_Faith] Faith in this city. Grants 4 Warrior Monks (if player has founded a religion or if there is a majority religion for this player or city). Must be built adjacent to a Holy Site district with a Temple.

+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith on all Coast tiles in your empire. Extra +1 [ICON_Science] Science and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture on all Coast tiles for this city. [ICON_GREATENGINEER] Great Engineers have an additional charge. Must be built adjacent to a Harbor district.

Upon completion 1 or 2 adjacent Canal districts are automatically constructed. This wonder tile also acts as a Canal district. Provides +5 [ICON_Gold] Gold to all cities that has Canal built next to the city center. Must be built on a flat land tile where this wonder tile and the adjacent Canal districts can legally connect two bodies of water or a body of water to a City Center.

+1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Production] Production on all Desert tiles in your empire (non-Floodplains). Extra +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold on all Desert tiles for this city (non-Floodplains). Must be built on Desert or Floodplains without Hills.

+100% [ICON_Tourism] Religious Tourism from this city. +1 [ICON_Food] Food on all Tundra tiles in your empire. Extra +1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture on all Tundra tiles for this city. Must be built adjacent to a City Center.

+3 Diplomatic Victory Points when built. When in a Golden Age, each of your [ICON_Citizen] Citizens exerts extra 0.5 Loyalty pressure in their city. This pressure also affects other cities within 9 tiles, but is 10% less effective per tile. Must be built on the Coast, adjacent to land and a Harbor district.

Grants 3 Archers, 3 Spearmen, and a Battering Ram. +30% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards anti-cavalry units. Must be built on flat land adjacent to an Encampment district with a Barracks or Stable.
Must be built on a Coast tile that is adjacent to a Theater Square district.

+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold on tiles with Breathtaking Appeal in your empire. When the Torre de Belm is constructed, cities not on your home continent receive the lowest [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production cost city center building they can currently construct. Must be built on the Coast, adjacent to land and a Harbor district.

Other Civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to this city provide +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for them. +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for every [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route to this city. Domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to this city give an additional +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith to this city. Must be built on the Desert or Desert Hills, and adjacent to a Campus district.
+1 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person Points from Holy Sites (Prophet), Campuses (Scientist), and Theater Squares (Writer).
City growth rate is 15% higher. +2 [ICON_Food] Food in all cities.
Border expansion rate is 25% faster. +2 Loyalty per turn in all cities.
Bonus [ICON_Faith] Faith equal to 50% of the strength of each combat unit killed (on Standard Speed).
Increases Healing by +20 in your Holy Site district or any adjacent tiles.
+50 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +50 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Barbarian Outpost cleared. The unit that cleared the Barbarian Outpost heals +100 HP.
+1 [ICON_Science] Science and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith from Geothermal Fissures and Volcanic Soil.
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold from Mines over Luxury and Bonus resources.
+2 [ICON_Production] Production from Marsh and Oasis.
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith from Pastures.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith from Fishing Boats.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture from Plantations.
+30% [ICON_Production] Production toward districts in cities without a specialty district. +5% [ICON_Production] Production toward districts in other cities.
+30% [ICON_Production] Production toward Ancient and Classical military units. +5% [ICON_Production] Production toward other military units.
+20% [ICON_Production] Production towards Ancient and Classical era wonders. +5% [ICON_Production] Production toward other wonders.
Allows construction of Cathedrals (+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist point per turn, 1 slot for religious art).
Allows construction of Synagogues (+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, Bonus [ICON_Gold] Gold equal to the adjacency bonus of the Holy Site district).
Allows construction of Gurdwaras (+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +3 [ICON_Food] Food).
Allows construction of Meeting Houses (+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +3 [ICON_Production] Production).
Allows construction of Wats (+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +3 [ICON_Science] Science).
Allows construction of Pagodas (+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing).

Shrines and Temples provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to their intrinsic [ICON_Faith] Faith output. These yields are increased by +50% if city [ICON_CITIZEN] population is 15 or higher, +50% if district has at least +4 adjacency bonus.
All world wonders provide +8 [ICON_Faith] Faith. +1 Appeal to all tiles if the city has a world wonder.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food from Farms on Floodplains.

May purchase Campus and Theater Square district buildings with [ICON_Faith] Faith. +1% [ICON_Gold] Gold for each citizen following this religion in the city with a Campus district. +1% [ICON_Faith] Faith for each citizen following this religion in the city with a Theater Square district.

International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes provide +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to cities with Holy Sites, and an additional +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every building in the Holy Site district. +30% [ICON_Production] Production toward Traders and Commercial Hub buildings.
+100% [ICON_Faith] Faith and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics. +1 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from every walls.

Allows spending [ICON_FAITH] Faith to train Warriors Monks (A land combat unit). +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith from Renaissance Walls and defensive improvements. An additional +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith if the city has a garrisoned unit.
+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity for each specialty district adjacent to the Holy Site district.
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith from each Holy Site and Theater Square district for each city following this Religion.
+1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith from each Campus and Commercial Hub district for each city following this Religion.
+6 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +6 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each City-States following this Religion.
+6 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +6 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each City-States following this Religion.
Combat units gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when within the borders of foreign cities that follow this Religion.
Religious units heal up to 20 hit points when they eliminate a unit.
Receives an Apostle when completing a Holy Site.
Culture Bomb adjacent tiles when completing a Holy Site. Cities start with this Religion in place if founded by a player who has this as their majority Religion.
Religious spread from adjacent city pressure is 50% stronger. Religion spreads to cities 50% further away.
Increases city garrison [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength by +5. Units defending within the city's territory get +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. Establishes in 2 turns.
Your other cities within 9 tiles gain +4 Loyalty per turn towards your civilization. +50% [ICON_Production] Production towards walls.
City cannot be put under siege. +50% [ICON_Production] Production towards support units.
Other cities within 9 tiles and not owned by you lose 4 Loyalty per turn.
While established in a city-state, provides a copy of its Luxury resources to you. +2 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn.

While established in a city-state, accumulate its Strategic resources. When suzerain, receive double the amount of accumulated strategic resources. Alliance Points with all allies increase by an additional .25 per turn.
Religious pressure to adjacent cities is 100% stronger from this city. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every specialty district in this city.
+10 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength in theological combat in tiles of this city. City ignores religious pressure from Religions not founded by the [ICON_Governor] Governor's player.
Gain [ICON_FAITH] Faith equal to 25% of the construction cost when finishing buildings. +3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from each [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics.
Strategic resource costs for units are discounted 80%. Accumulating Strategic resources in the city gain an additional +1 per turn.

This citys improvements, buildings, and districts cannot be damaged by Environmental Effects. All Builders and Military Engineers trained in this city ignore [ICON_Movement] Movement costs of terrain and features.
+50% [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People points generated per turn in the city.
Reform the Coinage Golden Age:[NEWLINE]Your Traders cannot be plundered. International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold per specialty district in the foreign city.

Hic Sunt Dracones Golden Age:[NEWLINE]+3 starting [ICON_Citizen] Population for cities settled on a different continent than your first city. +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for naval and embarked units. +3 Loyalty per turn for cities not on your original [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent.

Monumentality Golden Age:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for all Builders. May purchase civilian units with [ICON_Faith] Faith. Builders and Settlers are 20% cheaper to purchase with [ICON_FAITH] Faith and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes sent to the chosen player provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for both cities. The chosen player receives +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity.
All players may condemn units of the chosen Religion, and doing so grants 30 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor.
[ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes sent to a City-State of this type provide +4 of the City-States' yield type.
+20% faster [ICON_Citizen] Population growth but -6 Loyalty per turn in this player's cities.
+6 Loyalty per turn but -20% [ICON_Citizen] Population growth in this player's cities.

Nobel Foundation is awarding a Nobel Prize for Physics. Let's prove ourselves the most scientifically minded, and win this prestigious prize.
Nobel Foundation is awarding a Nobel Prize for Peace. Let's prove ourselves the most peaceful, and win this prestigious prize.
+3 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities in each of your cities if you have a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route from that city to your ally
Envoys sent to City-States you have a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route to count as two [ICON_Envoy] Envoys.
Allows Builders to embark, and allows harvesting of [ICON_RESOURCE_FISH] Fish and [ICON_RESOURCE_CRABS] Crabs.
Allows Traders to embark.

Provides one more level of diplomatic visibility on all other civilizations. All [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism yields from [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great Works of Writing are doubled.
Grants the ability to construct an additional Spy. +2 [ICON_Power] Power per turn to Hydroelectric Dam. +25% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism across your empire.

Unlocks Aircraft Carrier upgrade: Hangar Deck, Advanced Engines[NEWLINE]+1 additional aircraft slot. +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.

Pasture improvements receive +1 [ICON_Food] Food. Unlocks Aircraft Carrier upgrade: Folding Wings, Deck Crews, Supercarrier[NEWLINE]+1 additional aircraft slot. Can heal after attacking. Heal outside of friendly territory.
Can build Solar Farms on Tundra and Snow terrain.
Can build Offshore Wind Farms on Ocean terrain.
+1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn to Solar Farms.
+1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn to Wind Farms.
+1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn to Geothermal Plants.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production to Mines. Unlocks Giant Death Robot upgrade: Reinforced Armor Plating[NEWLINE]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against land and naval units.
